column4: Does anyone know why most Linux apps off of the web, i.e. Teamspeak won't install (open)?
define "linxu app off the web"
I was downloading Teamspeak from www.goteamspeak.com, and it says it cant read it or something. The package manager has a bunch of languages to choose from like Unicode-UTF8
those are tarballs, you have to extract and compile
right, that is a tarball
open up a terminal, and then cd to wherever it is
could you bring me up to speed on how to handle them?
right, "cd whatever" then do tar xf ts2_client_rc2_2032.tar.bz2
then do cd ts2_client_rc2_2032/
then do ./setup.sh
how do i get to the desktop in terminal?
teamspeak can apparently be installed with a gui. So says the readme
which one did you get, the client or the server?
client
ok right click on the tar.bz2, then click extract here. Then open up the folder, and double click on setup.sh
no
the readme, says that you should be able to do it by gui
double click it, that should work
it gives me options
execute
when I double click it I get a little install shield wizard looking thing
archive manager archives and unarchives that is it
thanks for your help. it makes sense now
